answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat

answers.answer:
Yes as Elephant Room communications. We have used similar tools for our own investigative work and decided to make them more widely available to others. 

https://checker.gitcoin.co/public/project/show/elephant-in-the-room-strategic-climate-solutions
answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer:
Pretty Good OSINT Protocol (PGOP) contributes to the OSS ecosystem by making advanced, AI-assisted open source intelligence tools accessible to the public. Most modern OSINT capabilities are siloed behind government contracts or corporate platforms â€” PGOP changes that.

We also provide data that can be integrated via oracle and use in a wide variety of ways. 

We are building an interoperable and immutable framework that is highly customizable and totally open source. 

Specific contributions:

ğŸŒ Modular Plugin Framework: Anyone can create and publish custom OSINT plugins for domains, wallets, leaked data, or AI workflows.

ğŸ¤– AI Integration Layer: Supports OpenAI, Anthropic, and local models for summarizing OSINT reports and automating investigations.

ğŸ”“ Privacy-First by Design: Integrates with Holonym to offer zero-knowledge ID verification â€” something never seen in typical OSINT tools.

â›“ï¸ On-Chain Publishing: Allows immutable public-interest reports to be published to IPFS, Orbit Chain, or Base.

All code is open source and contributions are encouraged through GitHub Issues, Projects, and community-led plugin submissions.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
PGOP is differentiated by its combination of usability, modularity, AI automation, and ethics-first design.

Use Cases:

ğŸ§  Investigative journalism: Trace wallet, DNS, and image info without reliance on centralized tools

ğŸ•µï¸â€â™€ï¸ DAO due diligence: Vet contributors using off-chain and on-chain identity tools

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Community protection: Scan tokens, contracts, and identities for scam indicators

ğŸ“¡ OSINT-as-a-service: Build plugins that integrate third-party APIs into scan workflows

Key Differentiators:

AI agents can generate scan summaries and flag threats

Modular plugin loader means devs can quickly expand it

GUI frontend for non-technical users: Have I Been Rekt

ZK privacy layer ensures redacted investigations stay safe

On-chain report publishing ensures transparency
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
Our development roadmap includes:

ğŸ“¦ Launching plugin store + contributor onboarding

ğŸ§ª Adding test coverage and CI/CD for main OSINT modules

ğŸ“² Improving Streamlit GUI + mobile workflows

ğŸ”— Deepening API integrations (Holonym, Orbit Chain, OpenAI)

ğŸ§  Launching PGOP Agent â€” an AI-powered investigation assistant

Grant funds will be used for:

Infrastructure (API credits, file hosting, VM deploys)

Bounties for plugin developers

Paying ZK contributors to integrate Holonym

Incentivizing privacy-preserving publishing of public-interest scans

Weâ€™re building a public good, and this grant will help ensure contributors can be compensated fairly.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Have I Been Rekt?
project.description:
# Pretty Good OSINT Protocol (PGOP)

> _Now, not only the bad guys have these tools._

---

## TL;DR

**PGOP (Pretty Good OSINT Protocol)** is a modular, privacy-respecting open-source OSINT framework built for journalists, activists, researchers, and ethical hackers. It combines AI automation, blockchain transparency, and privacy-preserving tech to **democratize access to open-source intelligence**.

We want a world where tools like face recognition, wallet tracing, contract analysis, and API aggregation arenâ€™t limited to governments and corporations.

---

## ğŸ’¡ What We're Building

- **PGOP**: Core modular OSINT platform with CLI, API, and GUI
- **Have I Been Rekt?**: Friendly web frontend (Hugging Face + streamlit)
- **Tool integrations**: WHOIS, Telegram, Discord, blockchain scanners, geolocation, PimEyes, Hunter.io, etc.
- **AI-powered workflows**: Use OpenAI and other models to summarize OSINT scans and automate multi-tool workflows
- **Privacy-first**: Integrates Human.Tech (Holonym) to verify humans with zero-knowledge proofs
- **Immutable audit trail**: Write results optionally to Orbit Chain or Base for provable investigations
- **VM-in-a-box**: Deploy as Dockerized toolkit on a local or cloud machine in minutes

---

## ğŸš€ MVP Features

- CLI + GUI for scans
- Wallet & domain lookup
- WHOIS + reverse DNS
- Smart contract analysis
- Telegram/Discord scans
- Face + image matching (PimEyes style)
- AI summarization + tags
- Export to Maltego
- Publish reports to IPFS or blockchain

---

## ğŸ”’ Privacy by Design

- No centralized data logging
- All API keys stored locally or via user-managed wallets
- Supports ZK-proof redaction of sensitive content using Holonym

---

## ğŸ”§ Tech Stack

- Python / Streamlit / Docker
- Hugging Face Spaces
- GitHub Actions for CI/CD
- OpenAI, Stability, and AI APIs
- Orbit Chain, Base, IPFS
- Optional wallet connect

---

## ğŸŒ± Who It's For

- Investigative journalists
- Security researchers
- Human rights groups
- DAO governance voters
- Community trust systems
- Open-source threat analysts

---

## ğŸ§© What's Next?

- âœ… Hugging Face demo live
- ğŸ”œ Extend AI workflows (custom GPT agents)
- ğŸ”œ Integration with Holonym ZK ID
- ğŸ”œ OSINT-to-IPFS/Orbit reporting
- ğŸ”œ GitHub deploy & VM script
- ğŸ”œ Figma-style onboarding + docs

---

## ğŸ™ Why We Need Funding

- Improve reliability and modularity
- Cover API usage for demos (OpenAI, PimEyes, Hunter.io, etc.)
- Support contributors & contractors
- Offer a hosted gateway for non-technical users
- Enable anonymous public-interest reporting

---

## ğŸŒ Letâ€™s level the field

Tools this powerful shouldnâ€™t be exclusive to nation-states, mercenary firms, or billion-dollar platforms.

> Weâ€™re building **Pretty Good OSINT Protocol** so **everyone** has access to information that matters.

---

ğŸ”— [GitHub](https://github.com/M0nkeyFl0wer/Pretty-Good-OSINT-Protocol)  
ğŸ§ª [Live Demo](https://huggingface.co/spaces/monkeyflower/pgop-demo)  
ğŸŒ [Website](https://beenrekt.com)

MIT License â€¢ Public good â€¢ Decentralized trust
